ETYMOLOGY: From Old French probabilité, from Latin probabilitās ('credibility, likelihood'), from probabilis ('credible, likely'), from probare ('to test, to prove').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun). Can be countable or uncountable.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The extent to which something is probable; the likelihood of something happening or being true.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 某事可能发生或真实的可能性或程度。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: There is a high probability of success for this project.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 这个项目成功的可能性很高。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun). Can be countable or uncountable.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A numerical measure of the likelihood of an event, expressed as a number between 0 (impossible) and 1 (certain).
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 衡量事件发生可能性的一种数值，表示为0（不可能）到1（确定）之间的数字。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The probability of rolling a specific number on a fair six-sided die is 1/6.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 掷一个公正的六面骰子得到特定数字的概率是1/6。

REGISTER: Formal and informal contexts, particularly common in academic, scientific, and statistical discourse.
